name: Mines of Tethyamar
description: A crumbling dwarven ruin riddled with traps, monsters, and dark secrets. It holds a lost forge and the Wayfinder Casing.
plotHook: The Wayfinder Casing is hidden deep within the mines.
location: Dagger Hills > East Slopes > Mines of Tethyamar

name: Llorkh
description: A gritty trade outpost on the edge of the Black Road. The cult operates in secret beneath the Wayward Spirit Inn.
plotHook: The cult is interrogating a captive party member in the inn’s cellar.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn

name: Flooded Forest
description: A dense, partially submerged forest teeming with life and magic. It is guarded by an ancient Treant who protects a Wayfinder piece.
plotHook: The Arcana Cell is hidden deep beneath the forest canopy.
location: Moonsea Region > North of Ylraphon > Flooded Forest

name: Pickled Wyvern Tavern
description: A smoky backroom tavern in Daggerford where the party first meets Mr. Jahz Haands and receives their mission.
plotHook: The party is entrusted with the Wayfinder Case here.
location: Daggerford > Market Ward > Pickled Wyvern Tavern

name: Sunken Netherese City
description: Ruins of an ancient Netherese city deep beneath the Moonsea, filled with arcane traps, magical constructs, and submerged secrets.
plotHook: Home of the Navigation Hud, a vital part of the Wayfinder.
location: Moonsea > Deep Abyss > Sunken Netherese City

name: Kwik-O-Asis
description: A desert oasis built around a precious spring, now at risk of collapse after the Desert Guards take control of its water supply.
plotHook: The party must restore water to save the community.

name: Goblin Caves
description: A multi-level cavern system near Phlan occupied by goblins under cult influence, filled with traps, rituals, and captives.
plotHook: Home to an Orb of Summoning and early clues of the cult.

name: Brother Samiam
description: A high-ranking leader of the Black Cult of the Dragon, Brother Samiam is stationed deep within a fortified stronghold in the Earthspur Mountains. Ruthless, powerful, and utterly devoted to the cult’s ambitions, he guards one of the most important components of the Arcanic Wayfinder.
plotHook: Guards the Infinity Gear, a crucial component of the Arcanic Wayfinder.

name: Deep Sleep
description: A powerful aquatic dragon with iridescent scales and ancient wisdom, Deep Sleep lairs within the lava-warmed depths of the Aquatic Crypt. Though not part of the cult, it has struck a deal with them to obtain Baphomet’s Dragon Slayer in exchange for the Gem Ring.
plotHook: Guards the Gem Ring and bargains for Baphomet’s Dragon Slayer.

name: Chaab
description: A Zhentarim operative captured by goblins. Once freed, he warns of the cult’s activities in Phlan and the corruption spreading through the region.
plotHook: Provides early intelligence on the cult’s influence in Phlan.

name: Mr. Jahz Haands
description: A charismatic Harper agent operating out of the Pickled Wyvern Tavern in Daggerford. Jahz entrusts the party with their first Arcanic Wayfinder component and sets them on the path to confronting the Black Cult.
plotHook: Gives the party their first piece of the Arcanic Wayfinder.
location: Daggerford > Market Quarter > Pickled Wyvern Tavern

name: Goblin Boss Jigglebelly
description: The rotund and ruthless leader of the goblin forces beneath Phlan. Jigglebelly has allied with cultists in exchange for magical trinkets and the promise of draconic power.
plotHook: Guards key artifacts and orders destruction of cult evidence.

name: Captain Smurtz
description: A rugged and superstitious river captain who ferries goods and passengers along the Delimbiyr River. He helps the party reach Secomber and survives a vicious ambush by cult forces along the route.
plotHook: Aids the party during a cult ambush en route to Secomber.
location: Delimbiyr River > South Fork > Ferry Crossing

name: Madame Eudora Cheesefroth
description: The stoic and tired owner of the Wayward Spirit Inn in Llorkh. Though complicit in harboring cultists, she may be doing so under duress or fear for her daughter’s safety.
plotHook: Knows of the cult's presence and may aid or hinder the party.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn

name: Brother Samael
description: Samael is a fanatical cultist deeply entrenched in the Black Cult of the Dragon’s operations in Phlan. He oversees dangerous rituals and protects several relics in the Aquatic Crypt, including the Wayfinder Case and other demonic artifacts tied to Baphomet’s return.
plotHook: Guards the Arcanic Wayfinder Case and other Baphomet-linked relics.

name: Spanky
description: A fast-talking Harper liaison who recruits the party from Madame Freona’s Tea Kettle. Though flamboyant, Spanky is deeply committed to halting the cult’s rise and has insider knowledge of their artifact pursuits.
plotHook: Connects the party to the Harpers and sets the quest in motion.

name: Jubgub
description: A conniving human who betrays prisoners to the Black Cult in exchange for wealth and power. He operates in the Goblin Arena and keeps a dragon egg hidden beneath the sand.
plotHook: Holds a dragon egg and coordinates prisoner transfers to the cult.

name: Fuzzbuzz
description: A goblin arena wrangler who delights in the suffering of prisoners. He manages the release of caged monsters during matches and works directly under cult supervision.
plotHook: Runs the arena and controls prisoner fates and creature releases.

name: Goblin Shaman Zegg’Zarr
description: The spiritual leader of the goblins in the Phlan caves, Zegg’Zarr is a cruel shaman who conducts rituals to empower summoned beasts and dragons with toxic green fluids provided by the cult.
plotHook: Oversees summoning rites using cult-enhanced potions.

name: Delyth Cheesefroth
description: The daughter of Madame Cheesefroth, Delyth is a quiet and frightened young woman who knows about the cultists hiding in her inn’s cellar, but is too afraid to speak unless earned through trust.
plotHook: Knows cult secrets but needs reassurance to speak out.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn

name: Bron Greenwhistle
description: The stablemaster of the Wayward Spirit Inn, Bron notices more and more cloaked strangers arriving at odd hours. He's suspicious but cautious, and might be persuaded to share what he knows.
plotHook: Can confirm cultist traffic at the inn if convinced.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn

name: Gruff Ironfoot
description: A blacksmith in Secomber who suspects something foul brewing in the nearby mines. Gruff is wary of outsiders but recognizes cult sabotage and values loyalty above coin.
plotHook: Hints at ancient relics buried in abandoned mines beneath the region.

name: Lila Sunsong
description: A bard who sings folklore and coded ballads about the Arcanic Wayfinder and the Black Cult. She performs at the Jumbled Jester Festival and passes whispers to the party in song.
plotHook: Offers cryptic clues about artifact locations via music.

name: Fenton Quickfingers
description: A halfling rogue and fence who trades in rumors, relics, and rare maps. Fenton walks the line between Harper informant and self-serving scoundrel, always happy to sell information—for a price.
plotHook: Knows the black market routes for cult artifact trade.
location: Secomber > Market Row > Back Alley Stall

name: Seraphina Moonshadow
description: An eccentric herbalist living in the woods near Secomber. Seraphina experiences visions linked to the Wayfinder and Baphomet’s looming presence, but interprets them in dreamlike riddles.
plotHook: Provides visions or potions that aid in cult resistance.

name: Captain Redbeard
description: A grizzled river mariner with years of experience ferrying goods along the Delimbiyr. Redbeard has witnessed strange cult activity and rumors of lost relics. He’s chatty, stubborn, and armed to the teeth.
plotHook: Provides river passage and clues about the cult’s movements toward Llorkh.
location: Delimbiyr River > Llorkh Route > Redbeard’s Barge

name: Grom Ironpot
description: A half-orc cook in the Wayward Spirit Inn who has noticed strange increases in the inn's food supply orders. Grom is gruff but honorable, and may speak out if he trusts the party.
plotHook: Can confirm the cult’s growing numbers in the inn.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn

name: Flintstown
description: A desperate farmer searching the goblin caves for his daughter Fram. Flintstown is terrified, poorly equipped, and blindly brave—a witness to cult activities he doesn't understand.
plotHook: Begins a side quest to find his kidnapped daughter Fram.

name: Fram
description: A clever child imprisoned by goblins for a cult ritual. Fram witnessed a summoning attempt and overheard key plans, though she’s scared and hesitant to share unless protected.
plotHook: Possesses firsthand knowledge of cult ritual details.

name: Goblin Guard Mojo
description: A goblin patrol leader loyal to Jigglebelly, Mojo is gruff and cruel, often seen barking orders or checking on supply stockpiles. He’s a low-level threat, but may sound alarms when startled.
plotHook: Can trigger reinforcements or reveal supply caches.

name: Goblin Guard Jomo
description: A lazy and dim-witted goblin who patrols the back corridors of the Goblin Caves. Jomo is more interested in napping than fighting and may be easily bribed or tricked.
plotHook: Could be manipulated to allow passage or cause chaos.

name: The Goblin Octopus
description: A strange aquatic beast kept as a guardian in the Cavern Pool. The goblins have trained it to lash out at intruders and feast on prisoners tossed into the water.
plotHook: Acts as a surprise guardian during exploration or rest.

name: Goblin Arena Spectator Vuzz
description: A sadistic goblin who frequents the arena to bet on and cheer for prisoner deaths. Vuzz loves gossip and may be bribed with attention or flattery for minor intel.
plotHook: Knows cult plans, but wants entertainment or coin first.

name: The Captive Spellcaster
description: An angry, foul-mouthed mage captured by goblins and held in the temple chamber. They’re chained to an altar and were nearly sacrificed in a cult ritual before the party arrived.
plotHook: May join the party or share insights into cult magic.

name: The Mummy King
description: A preserved undead monarch entombed beneath Thorne Island. Bound to ancient rites, the Mummy King guards Baphomet’s Orb of Dragonkind in silence until disturbed.
plotHook: Guards an essential artifact in a cursed tomb.

name: Zavira Drosk
description: A shadowy Harpers agent who operates solo deep in the wilds. Zavira trails cultists from afar, gathering intel for a larger operation. Rarely seen, she contacts only when needed.
plotHook: May appear at critical moments to provide vital info.
location: Moonsea Region > Remote Trails > Unknown Campsite

name: The Ghoul King
description: A monstrous undead sovereign dwelling deep within the Mines of Tethyamar. He commands a legion of ghouls and whispers through the dark, hungering for living flesh and ancient secrets.
plotHook: Guards the final descent into Chasmfall Castle.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Ghoul Warren

name: Commander Valdrek
description: Once a dwarven general of great renown, Valdrek now serves as the spectral commander of the Ghoul King’s army. He paces the Ghoul Warren in silence, forever enforcing the will of his undead masters.
plotHook: Must be defeated or honored to progress toward Chasmfall Castle.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Ghoul Warren

name: Hisclaveus Chasmfall
description: A brilliant arcanist who turned to lichdom in pursuit of knowledge and eternal dominion. Deep beneath Chasmfall Castle, Hisclaveus guards truths older than memory—and a mind twisted beyond reason.
plotHook: Holds forbidden truths about the Wayfinder, Baphomet, and the cult’s ultimate goal.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Vault of the Lich Lord

name: Vaelice
description: Once a powerful mage and consort to Hisclaveus Chasmfall, Vaelice embraced undeath to protect the path to his sanctum. Bound by frozen regret, she guards the Throne of the Ice Lich in chilling silence.
plotHook: Must be confronted or understood to access the Vault of the Lich Lord.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Throne of the Ice Lich

name: The Librarian Wraiths
description: Bound spirits who continue their duties long after death, these spectral librarians hover among ruined tomes in the deepest halls of Chasmfall Castle, attacking those who misuse knowledge.
plotHook: May provide lost knowledge—or attack on sight.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Wraith Archive

name: Spectral Tacticians
description: The arguing ghosts of ancient war advisors endlessly debate strategy in echoing war rooms. They test the party with riddles, tactics, and false orders—offering insight if outwitted.
plotHook: May grant safe passage or summon a trap based on player response.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > War Rooms

name: Gildrey of the Glade
description: A Treant of great age and wisdom who guards the Arcana Cell in the heart of the Flooded Forest. Gildrey speaks slowly but sees through deception and values harmony over haste.
plotHook: Protects the Arcana Cell, requiring trust or strength to claim it.
location: Moonsea Region > North of Ylraphon > Flooded Forest

name: Mysterio the Illusionist
description: A flashy performer whose grand act at the Jumbled Jester Festival goes terribly wrong. Unbeknownst to him, cultists use his illusion cage to kidnap a party member and flee toward Llorkh.
plotHook: Accidentally aids in a party member’s abduction during a performance.

name: Zirra the Scaled
description: A half-dragon cult enforcer who tracks the party across the Moonsea. Cold, calculating, and loyal to Brother Samiam, Zirra rarely speaks but always strikes with precision.
plotHook: Tracks the party and may intercept them before a major find.

name: Watcher of the Vault
description: A faceless guardian, possibly once human, now fused with ancient arcane machinery. It patrols the Vault of the Lich Lord with unnatural grace and unwavering purpose.
plotHook: Defends the final chamber of the dungeon at all costs.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Vault of the Lich Lord

name: Frough
description: An inattentive goblin guard who sleeps through his shifts and is easy to bypass. His post is near a dangerous bridge above a cavern pool.
plotHook: Easiest guard to sneak past on the Cavern Pool level.

name: The Hooded Figure
description: A mysterious cultist who oversees artifact collection and prisoner fights in the Goblin Arena. They rarely speak, preferring to watch and record everything for the cult’s superiors.
plotHook: Facilitates cult activities and smuggles dragon-related artifacts.

name: Sid Dishious
description: The charismatic merchant leader of the Kwik-O-Asis, Sid Dishious keeps the oasis alive through charm, deals, and careful neutrality. He now fears the Desert Guards’ involvement with dark forces.
plotHook: Tasks the party with restoring the oasis’s stolen water supply.

name: Jimmy Hammertoe
description: A one-handed dwarven smith with a loud laugh and fiery temper, Jimmy runs a weapons stall at the Kwik-O-Market. He’s rumored to have once forged weapons for a Harper strike force.
plotHook: May offer enchanted gear if impressed or aided.

name: Sally Goods
description: Cheerful and savvy, Sally runs the general goods stall in Kwik-O-Asis. She hears nearly everything in the market and trades in both rumors and rations. She knows who’s buying too much food.
plotHook: Can tip off the party to suspicious activity near the waterworks.

name: Flambo
description: A flashy tiefling enchanter with a love of showmanship, Flambo operates an arcane trinket stall. His charm belies a sharp eye for magical corruption—and he suspects something is off in the oasis.
plotHook: May help identify cursed items or spot cult magic.

name: The Giant Crocodile
description: Summoned by cultists to ambush the party on the Delimbiyr River, this monstrous crocodile is covered in scars and dark ritual runes. It attacks without hesitation and drags boats under the water.
plotHook: Used in a cult ambush during the river journey to Secomber.
location: Delimbiyr River > South Fork > Ambush Site

name: The Stone Gate Warden
description: An ancient magical sentinel that guards the entrance to Chasmfall Castle. It appears as a massive stone skull, requiring gemstone offerings and coded phrases to open the lava bridge.
plotHook: Blocks the way to the final relic chamber unless satisfied.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Stone Skull Gate

name: The Dragon Wyrmling
description: A young black dragon summoned during a goblin ritual in the temple. It emerges from acidic mist, still confused and unstable, and could attack anyone—or be convinced otherwise.
plotHook: Summoned in the Goblin Temple to protect the Orb of Summoning.

name: The Arena Hydra
description: Hidden in a reinforced cage below the Goblin Arena, this feral hydra is the final act in the goblins’ games—unleashed only if the crowd grows restless or if prisoners escape.
plotHook: Unleashed in the arena if chaos erupts or plans go awry.

name: The Fiery Eye
description: A magical construct and sentry that oversees the second level of the Aquatic Crypt. It scans for intruders and emits a powerful blaze that incinerates anything not carrying the proper sigil.
plotHook: Must be destroyed or bypassed to access Baphomet's Orb of Dragonkind.

name: The Leviathan
description: A titanic, deep-sea beast haunting the ruins of the Netherese city beneath the Moonsea. It moves like a ghost, slamming through walls and wreckage to protect ancient relics.
plotHook: Patrols the sunken city and guards the Navigation Hud.

name: The Frozen Sentinel
description: A magical construct bound to the tower in The Ride. Forged by the tower’s original wizard, it defends the Focal Orb with cold fury, emerging from enchanted ice walls.
plotHook: Protects the Focal Orb hidden in the tower’s heart.
location: The Ride > Frozen Tundra > Wizard’s Tower

name: The Stone Skull Gate
description: A semi-sentient gate carved like a giant skull, sealed with arcane locks that require rare gems and riddles to pass. It mocks intruders and punishes failure with traps.
plotHook: Blocks the lava bridge to the dragon’s chamber in the Aquatic Crypt.

name: The Abyssal Scribe
description: A cultist in possession of forbidden Harper texts hidden in the Wayward Spirit Inn’s cellar. They transcribe rituals and encode messages for the Black Cult’s higher orders.
plotHook: Carries intel about the cult’s plans and magical rituals.
location: Black Road > Llorkh > Wayward Spirit Inn > Cellar

name: The Runed Myconid
description: A mutated fungal creature found in the Dwarven Caves of Tethyamar. Etched with ancient dwarven runes, it may hold knowledge—or simply attack.
plotHook: May reveal forge locations or hidden passages if approached peacefully.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Dwarven Caves

name: The Sealed Oracle
description: An ancient dwarven entity entombed in molten crystal at the heart of the Tethyamar forge. It whispers secrets of the Wayfinder and the ancient war against Baphomet.
plotHook: Holds prophetic knowledge tied to the final artifact locations.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Ancient Forge

name: The Mournful Knight
description: A ghostly paladin haunting the Bloodspire Staircase. Bound by guilt and duty, he will test the party’s intentions before granting passage to the Vault.
plotHook: Only allows worthy adventurers to pass into the final sanctum.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Bloodspire Staircase

name: The Whispering Door
description: An enchanted door in the Netherese ruins that whispers temptations and secrets. It demands answers to riddles and taunts those who fail.
plotHook: Blocks access to the Navigation Hud unless bested in riddles.

name: The Rivershade Spy
description: A Harper plant disguised as a traveling merchant on the Delimbiyr River. Quiet, observant, and cagey, they track cult movements from the shoreline.
plotHook: May tip off the party to a cult ambush or recent movements.
location: Delimbiyr River > Midway Point > Riverbend Market

name: The Bloodscribe
description: A reclusive cult archivist located in the Chasmfall Dungeon who inks flesh-bound scrolls with forbidden lore. He cannot speak, but communicates through disturbing blood sigils etched into the walls.
plotHook: May know the final location of a Wayfinder fragment or artifact.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Chasmfall Dungeon

name: The Broken Knight
description: An armored specter found collapsed before the Ice Lich’s throne. The knight mutters prayers and seems caught in a loop of shame, perhaps tied to Vaelice’s past.
plotHook: May reveal the emotional key to Vaelice’s final weakness.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Throne of the Ice Lich

name: The Ghoul Choir
description: A group of magically sustained undead who chant and wail in eerie harmony within the Ghoul Warren. Their music keeps the restless spirits asleep—or calls them forth.
plotHook: Their silence or song can either guard or release the undead.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Ghoul Warren

name: The Cursed Archivist
description: A withered elf sealed in a crystal tomb within the Wraith Archive. Once a historian, he now rants in multiple voices about Baphomet’s return and the fall of the Netherese.
plotHook: Knows the ritual logic behind the cult’s summoning plans.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Wraith Archive

name: Mistmaw
description: A swamp-dwelling serpent worshiped by cultists in the northern Moonsea wetlands. Mistmaw is not fully sentient, but its presence warps the land and dreams of those nearby.
plotHook: May be used to corrupt or shield a Wayfinder fragment.
location: Moonsea Region > Northern Wetlands > Mistmaw’s Hollow

name: The Warden of Bones
description: A skeletal entity that silently roams the halls of Chasmfall’s high-security wing. Armed with keys and blades, it executes any prisoner found 'disloyal' even in undeath.
plotHook: Carries keys needed to access restricted vaults and cells.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > High-Security Cells

name: The Wailing Librarian
description: This spirit weeps ink as it attempts to guard its collection of lore in the Vault of the Lich Lord. It attacks anyone who damages the texts or enters uninvited.
plotHook: Possesses records of early cult activities and prophecies.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Vault of the Lich Lord

name: Green-Eye the Thief
description: A halfling sneak once hired to find relics in the Aquatic Crypt. Her greed led her too deep. Now, she haunts the lower chambers, phasing between shadow and stone.
plotHook: Knows hidden passages and failed cult bargains.

name: The Eyes of Eldrathan
description: A cluster of animated orbs that once belonged to Eldrathan, creator of the Wayfinder. They hover and surveil, whispering truth or madness depending on who speaks first.
plotHook: Reveal forgotten Wayfinder lore—if spoken to properly.
location: Moonsea Region > Unknown > Wayfinder Echo Site

name: The Echo of Eldrathan
description: A semi-aware projection of the mage who created the Arcanic Wayfinder. It appears only when certain artifacts align and speaks cryptic warnings.
plotHook: Can provide final confirmation about the Wayfinder’s purpose.
location: Moonsea Region > Multiple Sites > Artifact Nexus

name: Goblin Shaman
description: The spiritual leader of the goblin cult faction. This shaman channels the green liquid’s magic to summon and strengthen creatures—including a black dragon wyrmling.
plotHook: Conducts the cult’s ritual and strengthens summoned monsters.

name: Mojo
description: A goblin guard tasked with patrolling the supply corridors of the goblin caves. Mojo is serious about his duties and is often found grumbling about Jomo’s laziness.
plotHook: Reports status to superiors and triggers alerts if provoked.

name: Jomo
description: A dozy goblin who often sleeps during his patrols. Jomo can be bribed, distracted, or used as a timing cue for sneaking through the goblin storage level.
plotHook: A vulnerability in the goblin defense if approached cleverly.

name: Captive Spellcaster
description: A bound and furious spellcaster found in the goblin temple just before being sacrificed. They can be rescued and might join the party or offer critical knowledge.
plotHook: Possesses insight into the cult's deeper goals and magic.

name: Octopus
description: A massive octopus lurks beneath the surface of the underground lake. Released only during special rituals or if a prisoner escapes, it's feared even by the goblins.
plotHook: Acts as a lurking threat during rest or chaos in the pool cavern.

name: Giant Crocodile
description: Summoned by the Black Cult of the Dragon during a river ambush, this crocodile was enhanced with dark runes and nearly capsized the party’s boat en route to Secomber.
plotHook: Leads the cult ambush along the river toward Secomber.
location: Delimbiyr River > South Fork > Ambush Site

name: Ghoul King
description: An undead monarch who rules the feasting halls of the Ghoul Warren. Though seemingly in command, he is a puppet bound to Hisclaveus’s necromantic will—his hunger endless, his rule hollow.
plotHook: Blocks access to the castle bridge and controls lower-level undead.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Ghoul Warren

name: Library Wraiths
description: Twisted undead scholars who haunt the forgotten archives of Chasmfall Castle. They guard scrolls and tomes of immense power, attacking those who disturb or misread them.
plotHook: May hold secrets of the cult or the Wayfinder’s origin if not provoked.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Wraith Archive

name: Ghost Knights
description: Bound by ancient oaths, these spectral defenders continue to patrol the halls of Chasmfall Castle. Some seek redemption, others attack anything living that crosses their path.
plotHook: May be reasoned with—or become immediate threats depending on approach.
location: Dagger Hills > Mines of Tethyamar > Chasmfall Castle

name: Arcanic Wayfinder Navigation Hud
description: A lost magical interface located in a submerged ruin beneath the Moonsea. It's part of the Arcanic Wayfinder system.
plotHook: Required to complete the Arcanic Wayfinder and track Baphomet.

name: Gems of Navigation
description: A pouch of magical gems provided by the Harpers that activate the Arcanic Wayfinder when all components are assembled.
plotHook: Allows the completed Wayfinder to locate Baphomet's gear.

name: Wayfinder Arcana Cell
description: A powerful magical cell used to stabilize the Arcanic Wayfinder, protected by an ancient Treant in the Flooded Forest.
plotHook: One of eight parts required to restore the Wayfinder.
location: Moonsea Region > North of Ylraphon > Flooded Forest

name: Orb of Summoning
description: A dark artifact capable of aiding in the summoning of Baphomet. Hidden within the Goblin Temple under cult protection.
plotHook: Must be secured or destroyed to prevent the ritual.

name: Baphomet’s Dragon Slayer
description: A legendary weapon hidden in the volcanic depths of the Aquatic Crypt. Desired by a dragon in exchange for another artifact.
plotHook: Needed to retrieve the Gem Ring from Deep Sleep.

name: Messenger Bag and Note
description: A leather bag containing a ritual knife and instructions from the Black Cult. Left with a goblin commander to hide their trail.
plotHook: Contains instructions to destroy evidence of summoning.

name: Focal Orb
description: An ancient magical orb found in a frozen wizard’s tower in The Ride. Needed to restore the Arcanic Wayfinder’s guidance functions.
plotHook: Critical to the Wayfinder's ability to detect planar shifts.
location: The Ride > Frozen Tundra > Wizard’s Tower

name: Festival of the Jumbled Jester
description: An eccentric festival in Secomber featuring riddles, performances, and feasting. The cult uses it as cover for a kidnapping.
plotHook: A cultist kidnaps a party member during a performance act.

name: Ale to the King
description: A competitive riddle-based pub crawl held during the Jumbled Jester Festival. Winners earn titles and town-wide perks.
plotHook: Winning gives access to key allies and secrets in Secomber.

name: Water Restoration Ritual
description: A public ritual at the Kwik-O-Asis marking the return of water to the desert community and the party’s heroic success.
plotHook: Celebrates the players’ success and cements their influence.

name: The Disappearing Act
description: An illusionist’s performance gone wrong—or right—where a party member is magically kidnapped by cultists mid-show.
plotHook: Triggers a rescue mission and reveals cult activity.

name: River Ambush
description: The party is attacked by cultists and a summoned creature while en route to Secomber by river. The attack blocks their path forward.
plotHook: Tests the party and reveals the cult is tracking them.
location: Delimbiyr River > South Fork > Ambush Site

name: The Great Riddle Crawl
description: A town-wide riddle competition held during festival week. Participants must solve riddles at various locations while drinking heavily.
plotHook: Winning provides vital NPC access and bonus gear.

name: The Black Cult of the Dragon
description: A radical organization devoted to summoning dragons and Baphomet to reshape Faerûn through chaos, death, and domination.
plotHook: The primary antagonists, they possess artifacts needed to summon Baphomet.

name: The Harpers
description: A secretive network of spies, bards, and agents working to protect the balance of power and prevent cataclysmic threats to the realm.
plotHook: They enlist the party to stop the Black Cult and guide them to Wayfinder pieces.

name: Zhentarim
description: A powerful mercenary syndicate with unclear motives—sometimes allies, sometimes rivals in the hunt for lost artifacts.
plotHook: Offer information or interference in the search for Wayfinder parts.

name: Desert Guards
description: A militarized group controlling the water supply in the Badlands. Their motives are suspicious and likely tied to cult activity.
plotHook: Cut off water to the Kwik-O-Asis, possibly on cult orders.

name: Order of the Arcane Dawn
description: A reclusive magical order dedicated to recovering ancient Netherese artifacts, some of which intersect with the Wayfinder.
plotHook: May hold or protect one of the Wayfinder components.
